doc.title: Wodka, Jazz & Some Private Moments
doc.plot: Updated version of "Wodka, Jazz, and Perestroika" - a kind of no directors cut. Like the first edition - this is a cutting-room-result. 1989: A bunch of Austrian Jazz-Musicians enters "glasnost"-Russia with a concert-tour trough an unknown country. 1995: filmmaker Carl Andersen got the original tour-tapes from the musicians - and cut down the music. The result was too much privacy for the (ex) Band-Members. 2001: Andersen cut down much more of the music. The result: a very private look on people (musicians) from east and west and their tries, coming together in any sense.
